title.hi: A New SONG, in Praise of

lg.l:
Tune of The City Ramble,
Give Ear to my frolÂ·cksome Ditty,
Of one that a Wager would lay, &e.

The Answer to the Authors of the Foregoing Verses.
When to Women you make your Address Sirs,
Rememember the old Decalogue,
Take heed that you never Transgress, Sirs,
With that beautiful Toast Molly M
SAys my Uncle i pray now discoverWhat has been the Cause of your Woes,
That you pine and whine like a Lover,I'have seen Molly Mogg at the Rose.
O Nephew, your Grief is a Folly.In town you may find your prog,
Half a Crown there will get you a Molly,A Molly much better than Mogg.
The School-boys delight in a Play-day,School-master's Joy is to flog;
Fop is the delight of a Lady,But mine is in sweet Molly Mogg. leads the Trav'ller a gaddingthro' Ditch, thro' Quagmire and Bog;
Will o' Wisp
But no Light can set me a-madding.But the Eyes of my sweet Molly Mogg,
For Guineas in other Men's-breeches,Your Gamesters they'll palm and they'll cog
But i envy them none of their Riches,So palm with my sweet Molly Mogg.
The Heart thats half wounded is ranging,It here and there leaps like a Frog:
But my Heart it can never be changing,It's so fixed on my sweet Molly Mogg,
I know that by Wits 'tis recited,That Women at best are a Clog,
But I am not easily frightedFrom loving my Sweet Molly Mogg.
A Letter when I am inditing.Comes Cupid and gives me a Jog,
And I fill all my Paper with Writing,Of nothing but sweet Molly Mogg,
I feell I'm in Love to Distraction,My Senses are lost in a Fog,
And in nothing can find Satisfaction,But in thoughts of my Sweet Molly Mogg,
If I would not give up the three Graces,I wish I were hang'd like a Dog,
And at Court all the Drawing-rooms faces,For a Glance of my Sweet Molly Mogg.
For those Faces want Nature and Spirit,and seem as cut out of a Log,
Juno, Venus, and Pallas's merit,unite in my sweet Molly Mogg.
Were Virgil alive with his Phillis,And writing another Eclogue,
Both his Phillis and fair Amarillis,He'd give for my sweet Molly Mogg.
When Molly comes up with the Liquor,Then Jealousy sets me a-gog.
To besure she's a bit for the Vicar,And so I shall loose Molly Mogg.
